hypothesis_content.title: Post-CPI Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a major scheduled catalyst (CPI/FOMC) that results in a sharp intraday reversal (>3% BTC move) but closes within ±1.5% of pre-announcement levels, the subsequent 24-hour period will see a directional move that amplifies the initial post-announcement impulse, as trapped liquidity and repositioning flows dominate.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Major catalysts often create violent but indecisive moves as algorithms and fast money react. A close near the pre-event price suggests equilibrium was not found, setting up for a sustained directional move as slower institutional and trend-following capital enters.
entry_conditions: BTC experiences >3% intraday range (high to low) within 2 hours of CPI/FOMC release
BTC 4H candle closes within ±1.5% of price 15 minutes pre-announcement
BTC 1H RSI(14) crosses above 60 (for long) or below 40 (for short) in the 4-12 hours post-close
Regime is NEUTRAL or BULL (VIX term structure in contango)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 2.5x the initial post-announcement impulse magnitude (measured from pre-announcement price to post-announcement extreme)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 1.5x the initial impulse magnitude in opposite direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of signals result in the 24-hour move being contained within ±1x the initial impulse magnitude, indicating no amplification occurs.
